statements: To increase public trust in institutions, we should pair greater transparency and accountability with a commitment to competent, reliable public service. People who are skeptical want clear evidence that rules are fair and mistakes have consequences, while supporters worry that constant attacks can weaken essential functions—both concerns can be addressed through independent oversight, open data, and consistent performance standards. Building trust also requires genuine two-way engagement with communities so policies reflect lived experience, alongside protections that keep institutions nonpartisan and focused on the public interest.
